item.title: More pupils sent home as Covid disruption soars
item.description: Rapid increase in pupils out of school in England as changes expected for self-isolation rules.

item.title: Dalian Atkinson: PC Benjamin Monk jailed for ex-footballer's death
item.description: He is the first to be convicted of manslaughter as a result of police contact in more than 30 years.

item.title: Police investigating after Chris Whitty accosted in park
item.description: Boris Johnson says he is "shocked" by the "despicable harassment" of England's chief medical officer.

item.title: Rare black hole and neutron star collisions sighted twice in 10 days
item.description: Separate collisions of a neutron star and a black hole are detected in a short space of time.

item.title: Foreign business leaders may get quarantine exemption
item.description: Executives visiting England from amber-list countries will not need to isolate if trip is a big economic benefit.

item.title: Scottish government lifts Manchester travel ban
item.description: The ban had sparked a row between First Minister Nicola Sturgeon and Greater Manchester Mayor Andy Burnham.

item.title: Elvis Costello defends Olivia Rodrigo over Brutal plagiarism claim
item.description: Elvis Costello gives a relaxed response after pop star Olivia Rodrigo is accused of copying his music.

item.title: Covid-19: Republic of Ireland to use indoor hospitality vaccine pass
item.description: The Irish government is to delay the return of some indoor activities scheduled for 5 July.

item.title: Queen's Platinum Jubilee: Reign to be marked at street pageant
item.description: Marching bands, troops and street theatre will feature in a spectacular parade in central London.

item.title: Jamie Lynn Spears: I'm so proud of Britney for using her voice
item.description: Britney Spears' younger sister backs the singer after her powerful appearance in court last week.

item.title: Brewdog: Watchdog urged to probe solid gold can prize claim
item.description: The brewery company could be in hot water as winners dispute the value of the "solid gold" beer cans.

item.title: Self-isolating students in end-of-tenancy 'nightmare'
item.description: What happens if a housemate tests positive for Covid just as you were about to move out?

item.title: Love Island: Megan Barton-Hanson wants a more diverse cast
item.description: Former Love Island contestant Megan Barton-Hanson says she wants to see more diversity in this year's show.

item.title: Canada Heatwave: Bears take a dip in record breaking temperatures
item.description: Three mischievous bears have a pool day as Canada reaches record breaking temperatures in British Columbia.

item.title: Your Scotland sunset pictures
item.description: A selection of readers' photographs of Monday's stunning sunset.

item.title: Australian farmer spreads joy with colourful rescue lambs
item.description: Australian farmer Tracey Kruger spreads joy with pictures of her rescue lambs in colourful outfits.

item.title: Inside India's deadly mucormycosis fungus epidemic
item.description: BBC correspondent Yogita Limaye visits a ward battling India's mucormycosis epidemic in the wake of Covid.

item.title: The precarious life of a Gaza fisherman
item.description: Fishermen in Gaza eke out a precarious living amid restrictions over where they can cast their nets.

item.title: Mother's plea after daughter dies swallowing button battery
item.description: Harper-Lee Fanthorpe died in Stoke-on-Trent in May after swallowing a battery from a remote control.

item.title: Marr on catching Covid after being double vaccinated
item.description: The BBC's Andrew Marr fell ill with Covid-19, despite being vaccinated twice.

item.title: Cardi B reveals pregnancy at BET Awards
item.description: The star announced she was expecting her second child as she picked up two awards for rap anthem WAP.

item.title: The cat cafe helping homeless felines
item.description: Java Whiskers is London’s latest cat cafe and is currently home to nine felines who have been looking for new owners.

item.title: British Jews' fear and defiance amid record monthly anti-Semitism reports
item.description: Some 460 anti-Semitic incidents were reported to the Community Security Trust from 8 May to 7 June.

item.title: Miami building collapse: What could have caused it?
item.description: The search for survivors continues but experts must now piece together what caused a Miami apartment block to collapse.

item.title: Covid: Parents 'were treated like criminals' as their son lay dying
item.description: Ollie Bibby's parents are "livid" that Matt Hancock broke rules that they were forced to observe.

item.title: Why small investors are piling into share-trading apps
item.description: A boom in cheaper trading is tempting some inexperienced investors to take big risks, warn experts.

item.title: A Pride symbol vandalised in Canada's 'prettiest little town'
item.description: A rainbow pedestrian crossing in Paris, Ontario was vandalised, and the town rallied to fix it.

item.title: 'Holiday food poisoning left me paralysed'
item.description: Malcolm Brown developed a rare autoimmune disease after suffering food poisoning while on a self-catering trip.

item.title: Covid: How Delta exposed Australia's pandemic weaknesses
item.description: Australia's most dangerous virus surge in a year has prompted lockdowns and calls for faster vaccinations.

item.title: 377: The British colonial law that left an anti-LGBTQ legacy in Asia
item.description: Created by the British, 377 has had a widespread damaging effect in former colonies, say activists.

item.title: Justice DJ and producer Gaspard Augé on his 'epic' Euro 2020 theme song
item.description: One half of French electro stars Justice has provided the soundtrack to a summer of football.

item.title: Israeli minister's landmark visit to UAE signals deepening ties
item.description: Yair Lapid is the first Israeli minister to visit the Gulf state since they normalised relations.

item.title: Anne Robinson on Countdown and cancel culture
item.description: The presenter is taking over from Nick Hewer as the host of Channel 4's daytime quiz show.

item.title: Euro 2020: How 'world-class' Paul Pogba ran France's midfield against Switzerland
item.description: Alex Scott and Micah Richards analyse the "world-class" performance of France midfielder Paul Pogba in the world champions' Euro 2020 last-16 defeat by Switzerland on penalties.

item.title: England v Sri Lanka: Sam Billings' 40-metre direct hit ends Sri Lanka innings
item.description: Sri Lanka's Praveen Jayawickrama is run out by England' Sam Billings' brilliant 40-metre direct hit during the first ODI at Emirates Riverside.

item.title: Euro 2020: England's Harry Maguire says he is 'match fit and focused' for Germany
item.description: England defender Harry Maguire tells BBC Sport's Kelly Somers that he is "match fit and focused" for "the biggest of games", the Three Lions' last-16 tie with Germany at Wembley.

item.title: Wimbledon 2021: Venus Williams beats Mihaela Buzarnescu to progress into second round
item.description: Watch the best shots as Five-time Wimbledon singles champion Venus Williams beats Romania's Mihaela Buzarnescu 7-5 4-6 6-3 to reach the second round.

item.title: England v Germany at Euro 2020: 'Time for England to redefine their biggest rivalry'
item.description: BBC Sport looks at a Euro 2020 last-16 fixture that could lay the groundwork for what England v Germany means for a whole new generation.

item.title: Two games, 14 goals, one giant-killing: The best day in Euros history?
item.description: Was 'Magic Monday' the greatest day in European Championship history?

item.title: Euro 2020: England's Bukayo Saka on GCSE grades, golf and Germany
item.description: England's Bukayo Saka tells Kelly Somers about his superb start with England at Euro 2020, his outstanding GCSE grades and his struggles to hit a golf ball.

item.title: Euro 2020 quarter-final fixtures, TV guide & route to the final
item.description: All you need to know from Euro 2020, who faces who in the last 16 and quarter-finals, plus when and where to watch the games.

item.title: Euro 2020: England-Germany is chance to make history, says manager Gareth Southgate
item.description: England manager Gareth Southgate believes Tuesday's last-16 tie with Germany represents an opportunity for his team to "make some history".

item.title: Euro 2020: Jurgen Klinsmann says Germany would fear Jadon Sancho - if he plays for England on Tuesday
item.description: Former Germany boss Jurgen Klinsmann says everyone in Germany is surprised Jadon Sancho has not had more game-time for England at Euro 2020 - but they don't want to see that change on Tuesday.

item.title: Euro 2020: Select your combined England and Germany starting XI
item.description: As England and Germany prepare to meet in the last 16 of Euro 2020, we are asking you to create your combined XI.

item.title: Covid: What's the roadmap for lifting lockdown?
item.description: There is 'no reason' for England's final Covid restrictions to last beyond 19 July, the government says.

item.title: What are the rules about self-isolating, testing and masks in schools?
item.description: Many entire classes are having to self-isolate at home because a pupil has tested positive for Covid.

item.title: Euro 2020 and Covid: How can I watch with my friends?
item.description: Covid rules are making things a bit different for Euro 2020 spectators.

item.title: Covid: What refund rights are there for holidays abroad?
item.description: What rights do you have if your holidays plans or rules change?

item.title: Coronavirus: When can we stop wearing face masks or coverings?
item.description: Wearing a face covering is currently a legal requirement in many places, but rules are under review.

item.title: Covid: When will I get the vaccine?
item.description: Over-18s can get a first jab in England, Wales and Northern Ireland, and second jabs are being brought forward.

item.title: Covid-19 in the UK: How many coronavirus cases are there in my area?
item.description: Explore the data on coronavirus in the UK and find out how many cases there are in your area.

item.title: Covid quarantine hotels: Women say they were sexually harassed by guards
item.description: One woman tells the BBC a security guard employed by G4S mimed sex while they were alone in a lift.

item.title: A fake wedding, and a $250,000 scam
item.description: How a British man's dreams of a future with his Ukrainian fiancee ended in financial disaster.

item.title: Gary Allen: The killer who nearly got away with murder
item.description: Gary Allen's conviction for the murders of two women brings a 20-year quest for justice to an end.

item.title: The Lazarus heist: How North Korea almost pulled off a billion-dollar hack
item.description: In 2016 North Korean hackers planned a $1bn raid on Bangladesh's national bank and came within an inch of success. But how did they do it?
